TextView.android:text: GENERAL RULES
The right to participate in the competition of college arts is restricted to the full-time and part-time students of constituent departments.
The overall chare of Arts and the programmes related rests with the General Secretary of College Union assisted by the Convener, Joint convener.
Participants must bring their own musical instruments, costumes etc or other special items required for different events.

An item in the competition will be conducted only if there is a minimum of three entries for solo items and three for group items. The competition for an item will be conducted even if the minimum required is not met due to the withdrawal of entries.
The college union will arrange stage and stage requirements. Special setting if required for drama, skit, etc will have to be arranged by the participating teams.
No makeup will be provided. Make up man, materials etc will have to be arranged by the participating teams.
Only for the following items external help (background music, lighting etc) at performance only can be sought if not specified otherwise. Solo dance, group dance, oppana, mime etc.
A rolling trophy instituted by the College Union will be awarded to the winning team. Further there will be another trophy for the runner up team.
Each individual can participate in 5 group items and 5 individual items.

POINTS AWARDED

Individual items:
1st place : 5 points
2nd place : 3 points
3rd place : 1 points

 Group items:
1st place : 10 points
2nd place : 6 points
3rd place : 3 points

Steering committee headed by the General Convener will be the superior body and the members of the participating batch will have to strictly abide by the rules and regulations laid down from time to time by the steering committee of the Union.
If any dispute regarding the results of the competition or such other matter arises the matter shall be referred to the Jury of Appeal and their decision shall be final.

THE JURY OF APPEAL

Convener
Joint Convener
Chairman
General Secretary
Arts Secretary
Vice Chairman
General Convener and Joint Convener of Arts

Complaints if any may be forwarded to the General Convener in writing through the concerned staff member who is in charge of the team within an hour after the announcement of the results. The charge of an appeal will be â‚¹100.
Competition will be judged by the panel of judges appointed by the College Union. Each panel will have a minimum of two members except for quiz.
If a substitute wishes to take part in an item it should be reported to the program committee by the batch captains, atleast one hour before the commencement of the competition.

Disqualification for violation of eligibility rules. Any disqualification of a participant on the ground of ineligibility will result in the automatic disqualification of the contingent for that arts festival.
The time schedule and the general rules of the events can be changed by the steering committee without prior notice.
Audio cassettes can be used for all the dance items and organizers will not be held responsible, in case of any audio failure or low audible quality.
An individual can participate in five numbers of individual items and five number of group items.
Performances that exceed given time limit for each events will be valued by the decision of steering committee.
The programme Committee may reschedule and pre announce programmes on account of any sudden development.
Any further changes to the rules can be made without notice by the College Union.

NOTE

In case of tie for the above titles, the number of 1st places won by the participants will be considered.

Further questions if any will be settled considering places won in group event.

In case, the performance exceeds the time limit the curtain will be put down and the micro phone will be cut off.

SOLO DANCE FOLK

Two participants per batch.
Only non-film songs are allowed.
The dance can be of primitive or folk but not a classical one.
Maximum time allowed for performance is 10 minutes and stage setting is 2 minutes.

ADAPT TUNE

The maximum time allowed per participant is 3 minutes.
Three different tunes or songs will be given to the participant on the spot.
The participant should have to dance according to the changes in tune.
One song will last for one minute.
Five participants per batch.

GROUP DANCE

There is no restriction seeking external help for the background music.
The participating team will be responsible for removal of the sets, properties etc immediately after the completion of the performance.
Judgment based on rhythm, formation, expression, costumes, makeup, co-ordination and overall effects.
Maximum number of participants is 10 and not less than 6.
Maximum number of accompanists is 3.
Maximum time allotted for stage setting is 2 minutes and performance is 10 minutes.
Maximum 3 teams per batch.

OPPANA (MALE OR FEMALE)

There is no restriction seeking external help for the background music.
Separate competitions will be held for oppana-male and oppana-female.
Maximum number of participants is 9 and accompanists is 2.
Other rules are same as that of group dance.
Only one team per batch.

THIRUVATHIRAKKALI

There is no restriction seeking external help for the background music.
Maximum number of participants is 8 and accompanists is 2.
Other rules are same as that of group dance.
Only one team per batch.

STEP IN SYNCHRO

Maximum number of participants is 6.
There will be a separating screen.
Judgment based on rhythm, formation, expression, costumes and synchronization.
Maximum time allotted is 6 minutes.
Stage settings are not allotted.
Four teams per batch are allowed.
There is no restriction seeking external help for the background music.

WESTERN DANCE

There is no restriction seeking external help for the background music.
The participating team will be responsible for removal of the sets, properties etc immediately after the completion of the performance.
Judgment based on rhythm, formation, expression, costumes, makeup, co-ordination and overall effects.
Maximum number of participants is 12 and not less than 4.
Maximum time allotted for stage setting is 2 minutes and performance is 10 minutes.
Maximum three teams per batch.
Song should be in English.

VIDEO CHOREOGRAPHY

There is no restriction seeking external help.
The participating team will be responsible for removal of the sets, properties etc immediately after the completion of the performance.
Judgment based on rhythm, formation, expression, costumes, makeup, co-ordination and overall effects.
Maximum number of participants is 10 and not less than 4.
Maximum time allotted for stage setting is 5 minutes and performance is 8 minutes.
Maximum three teams per batch.

NOSTALGIA

Songs used should be from films released before 1990â€™s.
There is no restriction seeking external help.
Maximum number of participants is 10 and not less than 6.
Performance is limited to a time of 8 minutes.
The participating team will be responsible for removal of the sets, properties etc immediately after the completion of the performance.
Judgment based on rhythm, formation, expression, costumes, makeup, co-ordination and overall effects.
Maximum three teams per batch.

KOLKKALI

There is no restriction seeking external help.
The participating team will be responsible for removal of the sets, properties etc immediately after the completion of the performance.
Judgment based on rhythm, formation, expression, costumes, makeup, co-ordination and overall effects.
Maximum time allotted is 10 minutes
Maximum 8 participants per batch.
Only one team per batch.

LIGHT MUSIC (MALE AND FEMALE)

Separate competition will be there for male and female participants.
Maximum 5 participants per batch are allowed for each.
The duration of the song shall not exceed five minutes.
Judgment will be based on the qualities like swara, thala, composition, general impression etc.

CLASSICAL MUSIC

Maximum number of participants is 3.
Event should be presented in Carnatic style only.
Maximum time allowed for performance is ten minutes.
Film songs are not allowed.
Judgment will be based on the qualities like swara, thala, composition, general impression etc.

WESTERN VOCAL SOLO

The number of participants is 5 per batch.
The duration of the song shall not exceed five minutes.
The language of the song should be English only.
Judgment will be based on the qualities like rhythm, coordination, composition, general impression etc.

GROUP MUSIC

No film song should be presented as group song.
The group song should be taken from Indian origin which can be of any regional language.
Judgment will be based on the qualities of singing only and not on the makeup, costumes and actions of the team.
Maximum number of singers in a group can be six.
Maximum time allotted is ten minutes.
Only one group is allowed per batch.

WESTERN GROUP SONG

The language of the song should be English only.
Maximum number of members in a team should not be more than 8.
Musical instruments can be used.
Judgment will be based on the qualities of singing and orchestra only and not on makeup, costumes and actions of the team
Maximum time allotted is ten minutes.
Maximum 2 groups per batch.
Karaoke not allowed.

GANAMELA

Maximum number of participants shall be ten.
Karaoke can be used.
The time allotted for the performance is twenty five minutes.
Four songs of any language should be performed. One duet song and a chain song is a must.
Only one team per batch is allowed.

MAPPILAPPAATTU (MALE AND FEMALE)

There will be separate competition for male and female.
The duration of the song shall not exceed ten minutes.
Judgment will be based on the qualities like swara, thala, composition, general impression etc.
Maximum number of participants is 5 per batch.

NAADANPAATTU

The group can consist of all boys or all girls or combined.
The duration of the performance will be a minimum for 6 minutes and a maximum for 12 minutes.
This does not include setting time which shall not be more than 2 minutes.
 Film songs are not permitted and the teams must present folk songs in Malayalam.
Only one group per batch is allowed.

DUET SONG

Four teams per batch is allowed, consist of a boy and a girl.
Film songs and karaoke can be used.
Time limit is 8 minutes.

DRAMA

The duration of the play should not exceed 30 minutes.
For stage setting and removal of properties up to ten minutes will be given.
The number of participants should not exceed nine and that of accompanists is five.
External help for light and background music may be sought.
The medium of the drama can be Malayalam or English.
Judgment will be on the basis of the qualities of the play like theme, work on acting, stagecraft, total design, general impression etc.
The team should give four copies of the script along with the language of presentation to the programme committee on the day of event.
Two teams can be allowed.

FANCYDRESS

Maximum time allowed for performance is two minutes.
Maximum 5 participants per batch.

MONO ACT

No accompanist allowed.
Judgment based on acting work and general impression.
Time allotted for performance is 5 minutes.
Maximum 4 participants per batch.

MIMICRY

Participants may mimic sound of machines and speeches of well-known persons etc including film personalities.
Only 4 entry per batch.
Marking will be based on :
Skill imitating.
Variety of sounds and voices imitate.
Presentation.
Time limit is 7 minutes

MIME

Three entries per batch will be entertained.
Maximum number of participants allowed to participate in this item is six.
Judgment will most likely be based on the qualities like idea, creativity of presentation, use of make-up, music and general impression.
Duration of performance shall be maximum of 5 minutes.

SKIT (MALAYALAM AND ENGLISH)

Maximum number of participants allowed to participate in this item is six.
Maximum time allowed for performance is 10 minutes.
Use of make-up, drapery and background music is allowed. No personal remarks, aspersions, character assassination etc. is allowed.
Participating team should submit three copies of the synopsis of the theme of skit, along with language of presentation on the day of registration.
The item will be judged basically on the qualities like theme, work on acting, stage craft, design and general impression.
Vulgarity or bitter insinuations in presentation should be avoided. Only innocent satire or humor is expected.
Maximum three teams per batch can be allowed.

KATHAPRASANGAM

Maximum number of accompanists shall not be more than 4.
Performance minimum of 10 minutes and maximum of 20 minutes.
Maximum 3 teams per batch is allowed.

TABLEAUX

Light arrangement should not be handled by anybody other than the students of concerned team however external help for background music may be sought for.
Maximum number of participants can be 7, not less than 4.
Maximum 2 teams per batch.
Maximum time allowed 7 min including stage settings.
